intro: Halophila ovalis var. bullosa, commonly known as the bladderworts, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the Alismataceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and flowering structures. The plant thrives in brackish or saline environments, making it a halophyte. Its reproductive strategy involves the production of buoyant, seed-like propagules that aid in dispersal. This species plays an important role in stabilizing marine sediments and supporting aquatic ecosystems.
